text: Jacques Necker (; 30 September 1732 â€“ 9 April 1804) was a banker from Geneva who became a finance minister for Louis XVI. He tried to make France's tax system better. His dismissal on 1789 caused the Storming of the Bastille. Category:1732 births Category:1804 deaths Category:French bankers Category:Swiss bankers Category:People from Geneva
title: Jacques Necker
